page.title: 14 THE BRANSHOLME MAISONETTES
page.content: The maisonettes are situated in the centre of the Bransholme estate in Hull. They are grouped in eighteen blocks which are built from pre-cast pebble-dashed concrete slabs. The blocks are six stories high and are connected by walkaways above ground level. Each maisonette has a balcony which residents use for hanging out their washing, sunbathing, and keeping plants on. There are lifts and stairs for people to reach their homes, and rows of garages for each block. There are areas of grass and bushes, and some play areas. The maisonettes were built in the early 1970's but they have become very unpopular because they let water in and the design is poor. One block has been dismantled for research into the reasons for the dampness.
